key_points: Tom Brady has announced the end of his NFL career after 23 years.
He won seven Super Bowl titles, five Super Bowl MVPs, three regular-season MVP awards, and made 15 Pro Bowl appearances.
Brady holds the all-time records for passing yards (89,214) and passing touchdowns (649).
In his first season with Tampa Bay, Brady led the team to a Super Bowl win, setting franchise records for wins, completions, and TD passes.
He was the only player selected to the NFL's Pro Bowl 15 times.
Brady participated in 16 conference title games and has the most Super Bowl wins by a player (7).
In 2007, Brady set a then-record with 50 TD passes in a season and led the Patriots to a 16-0 regular season.
He is considered the key factor in the New England Patriots' near two-decade-long success.
Brady's playoff and Super Bowl records include 1,200 completions, 13,400 passing yards, and 88 TDs in playoffs; plus 277 completions, 3,039 yards, and 21 TDs in Super Bowls.
Brady is regarded as a global icon and the greatest of all time (G.O.A.T.), earning over $333 million in his career.
